I was a lion living in the mountains,
The Fortunate One, the one who sees what is good,
the one who knows all, the best of those who speak,
came to the best of mountains.
Having killed a deer that was trusting,
at that time the Fortunate One,
Having raised the best of meat,
I gave it to the Teacher;
and at that time he was extinguishing me.
Through that faith in my mind,
and through the aspiration of my mind,
I delighted in the world of the gods.
I thought about what was skillful;
and through the recollection of the Buddha,
